meanings.definition: A person who is foolish or easily deceived.
meanings.sent1: Tommy felt like a baboos when he believed the fake treasure map.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a baboos and trust strangers too easily.
meanings.sent3: The baboos thought the 'magic beans' would grow a money tree.
meanings.sent4: She realized she had been a baboos, falling for his smooth talk.
meanings.sent5: Being a baboos in this city will lead to trouble.

meanings.sent1: His baboos in investing all his money in that scheme cost him dearly.
meanings.sent2: Running into the dark alley alone was a display of pure baboos.
meanings.sent3: The baboos of the group led them to follow the wrong path.
meanings.sent4: Her baboos in love left her heartbroken.
meanings.sent5: The baboos of youth often fades with experience.

meanings.definition: To act in a foolish or easily deceived manner.
meanings.sent1: She baboosed her way into buying the overpriced gadget.
meanings.sent2: Don't baboos around with things you don't understand.
meanings.sent3: He baboosed his friends into thinking he had a pet dinosaur.
meanings.sent4: The scammer baboosed many people into giving away their personal information.
meanings.sent5: Baboosing through life will only lead to regrets.
